full_summary:
### Stage 1 – Clear Lake Main Pier Repair, Riding Mountain National Park

**Reference:** cb-39-11983405
**Amendment Number:** 2
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0330/A
**Publication Date:** 2024-03-28
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-04-18T16:00:00
**Expected Contract Start Date:** 2024-05-16
**Expected Contract End Date:** 2025-01-31

#### Purpose

Parks Canada is soliciting bids for Stage 1 – Clear Lake Main Pier Repair, Riding Mountain National Park. This project involves repairing various sections of the Main Pier.

#### Requirements

- Widening the grassed area by approximately 2 m beyond the existing trees
- Raising the existing rip rap crest height and creating a 4H:1V slope to protect the pier against wave overtopping and erosion
- Increasing the rip rap layer thickness and adding a filter rock layer to dissipate wave action
- Making spot repairs to broken timber aprons and sills, and deteriorated tops of timber piles along the length of the wharf and viewing area
- Replacing the plywood backwall of the buried west wall

#### Deliverables

Contractor must perform and complete the Work no later than March 31, 2025.

#### Issuance of Award

A list of pre-qualified bidders from Stage 1 will not be released. The successful bidder of Stage 2 will be announced on http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

#### Evaluation Criteria

A two-stage selection process will be used. In Stage 1, bidders' qualifications will be evaluated, and in Stage 2, bidders will be invited to provide further qualifications and a financial bid.

#### Procedure

Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official. However, due to technical issues, Parks Canada is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba. Bidders must submit their bids via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document.

#### Contact Information

For any technical or contractual inquiries, please contact the Contracting Authority. Enquiries regarding this solicitation must be submitted in writing and received no later than five (5) business days prior to the date set for solicitation closing.

#### Acknowledgement

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent
